text: The methods of surveillance include chart review, medication review, laboratory-based ward surveillance, laboratory-based telephone surveillance, ward liaison surveillance, treatment and temperature chart surveillance, risk factor surveillance, antimicrobial use monitoring and microbiology reports (8). While the details of these methods are beyond the scope of this document, the principles of an effective surveillance system are: . to maintain accurate, efficient, confidential data collection; . to provide data on final infection rates stratified by multivariate risk for each surgeon and patient; . to use clear, consistent definitions of infection; and Â° to use standardized post-discharge follow-up protocols and proper maintenance of data.
